values.alignmentText: Stockholm and Gothenburg host a strong .NET scene across startups and enterprises; remote options and local grants fit Trey's Azure/game dev goals.

Sweden's secular culture is strong. Atheism is widely accepted and religion rarely surfaces in public life, matching your family's preferences.
In Sweden (SE), robust democracy with independent judiciary and media protecting civil liberties; only minor populist rhetoric.
Banking in Sweden is highly digital (Swish, BankID). Newcomers often need a Swedish personnummer to open accounts, causing initial friction.
Stockholm archipelago and Skåne beaches are scenic but have a short season and chilly water; usable for summer trips with some travel.
Stockholm and Malmö offer family-friendly boardgame cafes and active groups; Sweden supports kid-friendly, multilingual play.
Sweden tends toward respectful, health-focused talk; inclusive gyms and wellness culture welcome all abilities, with little body-shaming in public spaces.
Sweden's diversified economy and strong welfare nets support retraining; Stockholm's startup ecosystem plus grants/visas boost resilience.
Incidence in Sweden aligns with global norms; universal healthcare and robust screening (breast/colorectal/cervical) support early detection.

Stockholm and Malmö are very kid-friendly: safe crossings, abundant parks, stroller-friendly transit, and universal childcare.

Visa families in Sweden access subsidized childcare with broad eligibility; multilingual enrollment support helps speed up access.

Sweden's established studios offer highly competitive compensation with strong benefits and parental leave; attractive to international talent.
Sweden startup comp tracks medians after cost of living, with solid base pay and equity. Stockholm offers family-friendly benefits and universal healthcare.

Regular Swedish continuing education via universities, ABF, and local meetups; strong game/web dev scene supports ongoing learning.

Stockholm's cost of living is high; rents and services strain budgets, but strong pay and universal healthcare help with family costs.

Sweden's tech scene is solid but not abundant; some friction for specialized web/azure/game dev roles; remote options help families migrate.

Sweden's inclusive culture and LGBTQ+ protections align with our family values. Transparent diversity metrics and broad representation reinforce equality.
In Sweden, enforcement is proportionate with strong oversight; families rarely witness aggressive sweeps.
Sweden allows dual citizenship with the US with minimal reporting. You can retain US passports while living in Sweden.

Sweden's diversified economy and strong welfare nets offer steady work prospects and cushions for families like yours.
Sweden has a welfare-forward market blending private innovation with universal healthcare. Generous parental leave and startup support align with your family goals.

In Sweden, universal childcare, generous parental leave, and child benefits support families; safe neighborhoods and strong public services ease daily life.

Sweden's 480 days parental leave and universal child benefits, plus flexible work laws, offer a robust family safety net in SE.

In Sweden (Stockholm area), urban men favor minimalist, functional streetwear from Scandinavian brands; suburbs stay more classic.
In Sweden, women and feminine-presenting people freely pursue diverse careers and family roles; strong gender equality and childcare support your family.
Sweden (SE): firearms exist but licensing, storage, and training are strict; public exposure is low, with strong safety norms.

In Sweden's urban centers, fresh markets and diverse cuisines are plentiful; rare specialty ingredients may require a trip to a larger city.
Friendliness in Sweden varies by neighborhood. Expat networks in cities like Stockholm and Malmö help newcomers, but building ties takes time.
In Sweden, the game dev sector is healthy with major studios in Stockholm and Malmö; steady hiring suits Trey's goals.

In Sweden, gender roles are highly egalitarian; caregiving and leadership are commonly shared, supported by parental leave and universal childcare.
In Sweden, flirting norms are broadly egalitarian; most people value consent and openness. A few circles still expect traditional first approaches.
Sweden offers strong protections and healthcare, but visa holders must register locally and may have limited subsidies.
Global warming risk in Sweden is moderate: mild summers help, but Baltic storms and pests require ongoing resilience planning for homes and families.
Sweden offers an entrepreneur residence route, not a rapid startup visa; processing is steady with solid family support and grants.
Sweden's urban/suburban work culture is casual yet professional. Budget modest grooming time; polish for work but avoid daily over-critique.
Sweden's progressive culture supports diverse families; you'll find open participation in civic life with minimal friction, though formal recognition remains limited.
Sweden offers universal, affordable healthcare with strong pediatric services. Non-urgent specialist waits can stretch weeks, but access remains family-friendly.
Sweden offers universal care after residence registration; during visa enrollment, supplemental private insurance can ease gaps.

Sweden (SE) remains broadly welcoming to immigrants. Occasional policy debates exist, but people feel safe speaking languages and sharing traditions.
Sweden generally welcomes skilled migrants; learning Swedish and engaging locally reduces stereotypes and eases integration.
In Sweden (SE), K-12 access is universal and free with strong language support. School transfers are generally straightforward.
Visa-holding children in Sweden receive free public schooling with language support (SFI). Resources are largely comparable to those for citizens.
In Sweden's cities, English is widely used; most services are available in English, helping your family adapt while learning Swedish.

Sweden's game dev scene (Stockholm/Gothenburg) enables frequent playtests. English-friendly with strong local networks for tests.
In Sweden, Marxism persists in academia and among some left parties, but policy stays pragmatic. Open, pluralist debate fits a progressive family.
Sweden's masculinity norms support nurturing and shared parenting. Fathers' caregiving is widely admired there.
Mass violence is rare in Sweden. Authorities in Stockholm and other major cities communicate clearly, and safety protocols help families feel prepared.
Stockholm has a broad, English-friendly meetup scene for tech and families; most groups are accessible, though a few niches may use waitlists or fees.
Sweden uses collective agreements; wages generally meet living costs and childcare is subsidized, with strong protections even for entry roles.
In Sweden, gigabit broadband and reliable power are standard, with widespread 5G. Efficient transit and digital services enable smooth remote work and gaming.
In Sweden, urban centers are broadly accepting of non-monogamy. Suburbs tend to require discretion.
Sweden's culture values direct yet respectful honesty. Share concerns clearly while staying diplomatic in a pluralistic society that respects privacy.
Sweden's archipelagos and forests, with allemansrätten, offer abundant, accessible nature for the family.
For families in Sweden, disasters are rare and low impact; only occasional floods or windstorms, well-managed with Sweden's strong infrastructure.
Allemansrätten allows roaming forests, lakes, and islands in Sweden. Access to nature is within an hour of major cities via good public transport.
Stockholm's music scene is vibrant with regular concerts and festivals. Clubs can be pricey, but daytime events and family-friendly options help.
Stockholm and Gothenburg offer nightlife, but Sweden's alcohol rules and prices mean evenings require planning for a family.
Stockholm/Sweden hosts active game dev communities: IGDA Sweden and Futuregames alumni run regular meetups and jams. The scene welcomes families.
9 - Sweden's game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, and Gothenburg offer a strong dev ecosystem with hiring, grants, and events that fit Trey's interests.
Sweden typically has low obesity rates due to active transport and universal healthcare. Your family's Swedish lifestyle supports healthy habits.
Sweden's Malmö hub offers grants, Game Habitat, and publisher networks; payroll taxes are high, so startups must hustle.
In Sweden's cities, lagom pace and efficient transit yield calm days with short commutes; aligns with Sarah's slower pace.
In Sweden (SE), parenting is highly egalitarian with broad shared duties. Generous parental leave and universal childcare align with your family's values.
Sweden: citizenship typically after five years of residency; dual citizenship is allowed, so you won't need to renounce US citizenship.
In Sweden (SE), perceived corruption is very low; strong institutions and watchdogs back transparent, low-friction governance for your family.
Sweden generally respects personal space; in crowded Stockholm transit, expect closer contact and use gentle, clear boundaries.
Sweden values personal space; greetings are usually handshakes, hugs by consent. Expect polite distance in buses and queues, even with kids.
In Sweden (SE), mild summers and chilly winters yield outdoor-friendly windows about half the year; plan around shoulder seasons.
Sweden's constitutional monarchy with proportional parliament delivers transparent, resilient governance and strong rule of law, matching your family's values.
Sweden offers broad social tolerance for polyamory, esp. in cities, but official forms still default to two-parent models.
Sweden provides förskola from age 1 with capped fees and subsidies; widely available, though popular urban slots can have waiting lists.
In Sweden, private friskolor follow the national curriculum and are largely state-funded; options exist, but quality varies.
Sweden's fresh markets and school meals balance snacks; ultra-processed foods aren't dominating, helping your family access healthier options locally.
In Sweden (Stockholm), PMM (Games) pay trails global medians by ~20%; strong benefits and family-friendly policies help offset.

values.key: Product Marketing Manager (Games): Continuing Education Availability
values.alignmentText: Sweden has regular game-marketing meetups and university courses in major cities; strong instructors, though many advanced trainings are weekend/online.

values.key: Product Marketing Manager (Games): Education Pipeline Strength
values.alignmentText: Sweden has strong marketing and game-design programs that graduate PMMs, with Stockholm and Gothenburg as hubs. This indicates a solid Sweden-wide PMM pipeline.
Sweden PMM (Games) hiring typically takes 2-3 months with solid local talent; remote options help, though visa steps may extend timelines.
Sweden's game studios routinely operate in English. Many teams are bilingual (Swedish/English), matching your preference for English ubiquity.

Sweden's studios show low churn and long tenures; grants and family-friendly policies support Trey/Sarah in the game dev ecosystem.
In Sweden (SE), public and occupational pensions plus premium pension offer solid retirement income for long-term residents; requires ongoing contributions.
In Sweden, pensions depend on work contributions; visa holders need residency-years for full access. Start private retirement savings now.
Ruby roles in Sweden are sporadic and cluster in a few startups or consultancies. Expect hybrid roles and overlap with JS/DevOps.
Overall safe in Sweden; some suburbs experience gang-related incidents after dark.
Sweden has strong public schools and bilingual friskolor; expect enrollment planning and possible waitlists for English-language tracks.
Sweden's Baltic Sea stays around 18-20 C in summer; extended swims for a 5-year-old and 1-year-old may need wetsuits or a pool option.
Sweden generally has predictable seasons with cold, snowy winters and mild summers; plan for a couple of extremes (ice, storms), but daily life remains manageable.
Stockholm, Sweden experiences noticeable winter darkness. Regular outdoor breaks and occasional light therapy help maintain energy.
In Sweden, winters are long and dark with damp chill; summers are mild and bright, giving a generally manageable seasonal pattern for the family.
Sweden has a strong pool of senior tech/game leaders. Stockholm’s startup ecosystem offers experienced talent and funding options, though competition is high.
Sweden provides comprehensive, destigmatized sex education with inclusive, LGBTQ+-friendly resources; aligns with our sex-positive family.
In Sweden (SE), universal healthcare and generous parental leave underpin strong family support and accessible childcare.

values.key: Spacious Housing Benchmark (2k sq ft Rent)
values.alignmentText: 2k sq ft rentals exist mainly in outer suburbs of Sweden's cities. Inventory is tight; brokers or longer searches are common.
Spring in Sweden (SE) can swing from near-freezing mornings to mild afternoons; expect wardrobe changes as temps vary through April-May.
Sweden offers long-term stability with predictable policies and trusted institutions. Universal healthcare and strong social cohesion support your family in SE.
Sweden's pluralistic welfare state champions rights and evidence-based policy, matching the family's progressive outlook in a tolerant, supported society.

Stockholm, Sweden hosts a strong game-dev ecosystem from AAA to indie, with grants/EU funding and English-friendly, reliable broadband.
Sweden summers are typically 23-25 °C with low humidity. This makes outdoor time comfortable and sleep easy without air conditioning.

Sweden and its Nordic neighbors (Norway, Finland, Denmark) enjoy positive ties and easy cross-border travel and collaboration.
In Sweden's lagom culture, our family sees balanced pride in welfare and openness, while noting housing and tax challenges.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries
values.alignmentText: Norway and Denmark largely view Sweden positively, aligning with your family's emphasis on education and LGBTQ+-friendly policies.

Sweden's urban areas are highly walkable with solid pedestrian safety and transit. We'll route around a few busy arterials to keep the family comfortable.
Sweden broadly welcomes US migrants; robust integration and language-support programs; English-friendly services aid families settling in Sweden.
Sweden's design culture, eco-housing, and sustainable urbanism align with the family's progressive living interests and favor family-friendly policies.
Stockholm winters typically -5 to 1°C with snow. Daylight is limited, but public services keep commutes and schools running.

In Sweden, strong parental leave, flexible hours, and boundary-friendly culture protect evenings/weekends for a family-first cadence.
Sweden's collective bargaining covers most workers; strong protections, parental leave, and predictable hours support family life.
